name: Lemon Bacopa
description: Bacopa caroliniana, commonly known as Lemon Bacopa, Blue Water Hyssop, or Carolina Water Hyssop, is a hardy aquatic and semi-aquatic plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida, Texas, and other Gulf Coast states, as well as parts of Central America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and features oval to lanceolate, succulent, bright green leaves (1-2 cm long, 0.5-1 cm wide) arranged in opposite pairs along upright stems. The leaves have a distinctive lemon-like fragrance when crushed, hence one of its common names. Under high light, the leaves can develop a bronze or reddish tint. This plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit and can reach 20-40 cm in height. It produces small, blue to lavender, five-petaled flowers when grown emersed. In its native habitat, it grows in shallow water, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. It's extremely hardy and adaptable, making it ideal for beginners. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty and pleasant fragrance to aquatic environments.
